title: Young boy dies in Danville shooting; police continue to investigate
content:
Police officers responded to the 800 block of Edmonds Street at 4:30 p.m. for a report of someone being shot, according to a news release from the Danville Police Department.
Upon arrival, police found a child suffering from a gunshot wound to the upper body.
The Danville Life Saving Crew transported the youth to Danville Regional Medical Center where he later died, the news release stated.
The age of the victim was not released, and police did not offer any other details of the shooting.
Yellow “do not cross” tape surrounded the residence as investigators took pictures inside Saturday afternoon.
The house didn’t have a fence, so police tied tape around a patrol vehicle’s side view mirror.
The homeowners were not present. The only remnants of youth were a football in the yard, a burgundy scooter and a youth-sized basketball backboard on the porch.
Further up on Edmonds Street, two young boys played catch — blissfully unaware of the tragedy that occurred down the road.
Anyone with information is asked to contact Danville Crime Stoppers at (434) 793-0000 or crimetips@danvilleva.gov. Information given will remain confidential.
